remarks: Two functionals with the same kernel are equal if they are equal at any nonzero value.  (Contributed by NM, 2-Jan-2015.)
statement:
eqlkr3.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
eqlkr3.s $e |- S = ( Scalar ` W ) $.
eqlkr3.r $e |- R = ( Base ` S ) $.
eqlkr3.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` S ) $.
eqlkr3.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` W ) $.
eqlkr3.k $e |- K = ( LKer ` W ) $.
eqlkr3.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
eqlkr3.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
eqlkr3.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
eqlkr3.h $e |- ( ph -> H e. F ) $.
eqlkr3.e $e |- ( ph -> ( K ` G ) = ( K ` H ) ) $.
eqlkr3.a $e |- ( ph -> ( G ` X ) = ( H ` X ) ) $.
eqlkr3.n $e |- ( ph -> ( G ` X ) =/= .0. ) $.
eqlkr3 $p |- ( ph -> G = H ) $.
